meanings.definition: The state of being inherent or intrinsic.
meanings.sent1: The inherency of kindness in her nature was evident to everyone who met her.
meanings.sent2: The inherency of honesty in his actions made him a trustworthy person.
meanings.sent3: The inherency of laughter in the classroom made learning a joyous experience.
meanings.sent4: The inherency of music in her soul was like a symphony playing constantly.
meanings.sent5: The inherency of curiosity in children is a beautiful thing to witness.

meanings.definition: The quality of being an essential characteristic.
meanings.sent1: The inherency of bravery in his personality shone through during challenging times.
meanings.sent2: The inherency of creativity in her work made her stand out among her peers.
meanings.sent3: The inherency of humor in his jokes always brought smiles to people's faces.
meanings.sent4: The inherency of determination in her spirit was like a guiding light in dark times.
